full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 688 Filed 06/29/22 Page 225 of 353 Juror ID: 50 KNOWLEDGE OF CASE AND PEOPLE This case has been widely reported in the national and local media. There is nothing wrong with having heard something about this case. It is important to answer all of the following questions truthfully and fully. 34. Before today, had you read, seen, or heard anything about Ms. Maxwell? Yes No Unsure 34a. If yes or unsure, please state what you remember hearing, and how or from whom you may have heard (e.g., a friend, the newspaper, a website, social media). If you heard about Ms. Maxwell from a media source, please identify the media source by name: I read on a website that she was Jeffrey Epsteins girlfried - source was CNN.com 35. Have you personally formed an opinion about Ms. Maxwell's guilt or innocence of the crimes charged as a result of anything you have heard, read or seen? Yes No Unsure Not applicable, I have not read/seen/heard about Ms. Maxwell 35a. If yes or unsure, please summarize your opinion: -19- DOJ-OGR-00010978

text_blocks.content: This case has been widely reported in the national and local media. There is nothing wrong with having heard something about this case. It is important to answer all of the following questions truthfully and fully.
34. Before today, had you read, seen, or heard anything about Ms. Maxwell?

34a. If yes or unsure, please state what you remember hearing, and how or from whom you may have heard (e.g., a friend, the newspaper, a website, social media). If you heard about Ms. Maxwell from a media source, please identify the media source by name:
I read on a website that she was Jeffrey Epsteins girlfried - source was CNN.com
35. Have you personally formed an opinion about Ms. Maxwell's guilt or innocence of the crimes charged as a result of anything you have heard, read or seen?
35a. If yes or unsure, please summarize your opinion:

additional_notes: The document is a juror questionnaire from a court case involving Ms. Maxwell. The juror has answered questions about their knowledge of the case and Ms. Maxwell. The document is generally legible, with some minor issues with handwriting clarity.
